  • Constructor Details

    • ManagementCompany

      public ManagementCompany()
      No-arg constructor. Initializes every String to an empty String, mgmFeePer to 0, plot to a default plot, and properties

    • ManagementCompany

      public ManagementCompany​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String taxID, double mgmFee)
      Parameterized constructor with no info about plot. Initializes name, taxID, and mgmFee.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the management company
      taxID - TaxID of the management company
      mgmFee - Management fee percentage

    • ManagementCompany

      public ManagementCompany​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String taxID, double mgmFee, int x, int y, int depth, int width)
      Parameterized constructor with information about the plot. Initializes name, taxID, mgmFee, the plot's x coordinate, the plot's y coordinate, the plot's width, the plot's depth.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of management company
      taxID - Tax ID of the management company
      mgmFee - Management fee percentage
      x - x value of the upper corner of the plot
      y - y value of the upper corner of the plot
      depth - The horizontal extent of the plot
      width - The vertical extent of the plot

    • ManagementCompany

      public ManagementCompany​(ManagementCompany otherCompany)
      Copy constructor
      Parameters:
      otherCompany - The company that will copy everything from the current company

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the management company's name
      Returns:
      The name of the company

    • getPlot

      public Plot getPlot()
      Returns the property's plot
      Returns:
      plot object

    • getMAX_PROPERTY

      public int getMAX_PROPERTY()
      Return the constant "MAX_PROPERTY" which represent the size of the properties array
      Returns:
      The maximum amount of properties a management company can have

    • addProperty

      public int addProperty​(Property property)
      Adds properties to the properties array
      Returns:
      -1 if the array is full -2 is the array is null -3 if the array is not contained within the Management's company plot -4 if the plot overlaps other properties otherwise the index in the array where the property was added successfully

    • addProperty

      public int addProperty​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String city, double rent, java.lang.String owner)
      Adds properties to the properties array. Creates a property object with the parameters passed to it
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the property
      city - Name of the city where property is located
      rent - How much it costs to rent this property
      owner - Name of the property's owner
      Returns:
      -1 if the array is full -2 is the array is null -3 if the array is not contained within the Management's company plot -4 if the plot overlaps other properties otherwise the index in the array where the property was added successfully

    • addProperty

      public int addProperty​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String city, double rent, java.lang.String owner, int x, int y, int width, int depth)
      Adds properties to the properties array. Creates a property object with the parameters passed to it
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the property
      city - Name of the city where property is located
      rent - How much it costs to rent this property
      owner - Name of the property's owner
      Returns:
      -1 if the array is full -2 is the array is null -3 if the array is not contained within the Management's company plot -4 if the plot overlaps other properties otherwise the index in the array where the property was added successfully

    • totalRent

      public double totalRent()
      Sums up the rent of all the properties in the "properties" array
      Returns:
      The sum of all the rents

    • maxRentProp

      public double maxRentProp()
      Returns the rent amount of the property with the maximum rent
      Returns:
      Double, maximum rent amount

    • maxRentPropertyIndex

      public int maxRentPropertyIndex()
      Returns the index in the array where the property with the max rent is found
      Returns:
      Index of property with maximum rent

    • displayPropertyAtIndex

      public java.lang.String displayPropertyAtIndex​(int i)
      Returns the info about a property at a specific index
      Parameters:
      i - Index of the property
      Returns:
      Information about the property at index "i"

      Overrides:
